sailpoint.object

Class Rule

  • java.lang.Object
    • sailpoint.tools.xml.AbstractXmlObject
      • sailpoint.object.SailPointObject
        • sailpoint.object.Rule
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, sailpoint.tools.xml.IXmlEqualable<Rule>, sailpoint.tools.xml.PersistentXmlObject, sailpoint.tools.xml.XMLReferenceTarget

    public class Rule
extends SailPointObject
implements sailpoint.tools.xml.IXmlEqualable<Rule>
    A Rule contains a script that can be executed to perform custom logic. Each rule declares which language it uses, the source for the rule, and context about how the rule should be run.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  Rule.RuleTypeComparator 
      static class  Rule.Type
      Rules may be typed if they are intended for use in certain parts of the system proper use of types is necessary for the rule to appear in selection menus in the UI.

      • equals

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object obj)
        Description copied from class: SailPointObject
        We override equals so that two objects will compare equal if they have the same database id or unique name, but are different Java objects. This is necessary for Hibernate because caches commonly have to be cleared or objects from one session need to be used to match things loaded in a different session.
        Overrides:
        equals in class SailPointObject

      • isContentEquivalent

        public boolean isContentEquivalent(Rule other)
        Returns true if the "contents" of the specified Rule are equal to this, where "contents" means: signature language referencedRules source type but specifically excludes name and id. This method can be used during upgrade to determine if the contents of two rules are identical; it is also called by the more general equals() method.
        Parameters:
        other - the instance to compare to
        Returns:
        true if contents are equal, false otherwise
